transcripts.text: There are calls for out-of-control parents to be banned from children's sporting matches.  after an ugly confrontation in Perth's southeast yesterday.  Dramatic mobile vision has captured the moment.  a 13-year-old football umpire was attacked by a woman at a junior match in Thornley.

A junior football match turns ugly as a spectator attacks a 13-year-old umpire.  Oi!  Oi!  Oi!  Leave the umpire alone!  Oh my God!  The woman tackles and puts the boy in a headlock.  The under-11s match between Maddington and Thornley called off after parents and spectators stormed onto the Oval at Tom Bateman's sporting complex in Thornley yesterday.  You shouldn't have been on the oval.  Parents should not be on the oval.  Parents should not be on the oval at all.  Witnesses say the umpire was just doing his job when a supporter from Maddington Junior Football Club directed her anger at the teenager.  The umpire suffered minor injuries but didn't need medical attention.
We're providing a whole lot of support for him and he's in good spirits.
The incident inspired calls for sporting groups to consider stronger penalties for spectators and ban them from attending any future matches if they're caught behaving in this manner.
Sporting associations should do that.  ban these people from attending.  It's completely unacceptable for, in effect, a kid to be attacked by an adult.
The WA Football Commission says security at junior games isn't needed yet, but they're promising to be strong.  including possible lifetime bans.

It can be as strong as a ban and removing somebody from the club environment and being able to either participate as a player or be able to come down and actually spectate.  So we're really serious about this, that this is not a part of WA football.
No charges have yet been laid, but police are still speaking to a 46-year-old woman.  Shame on you!  It's a kid's football game!  Michael Stamp, Nine News.
